griffon.core.view

Interface WindowManager<W>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ShutdownHandler
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    JavaFXWindowManager, LanternaWindowManager, PivotWindowManager, SwingWindowManager
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractWindowManager, DefaultJavaFXWindowManager, DefaultLanternaWindowManager, DefaultPivotWindowManager, DefaultSwingWindowManager, NoopWindowManager

    public interface WindowManager<W>
extends ShutdownHandler
    Controls a set of windows that belong to the application.

    Windows that are controlled by a WindowManager can be shown/hidden using a custom strategy (WindowDisplayHandler)

    Since:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Andres Almiray

      • findWindow

        @Nullable
W findWindow(@Nonnull
                    String name)
        Finds a Window by name.
        Parameters:
        name - the value of the of the Window's name
        Returns:
        a Window if a match is found, null otherwise.

      • getAt

        @Nullable
W getAt(int index)
        Convenience method to get a managed Window by index.

        Follows the Groovy conventions for overriding the [] operator.

        Parameters:
        index - the index of the Window to be retrieved
        Returns:
        the Window found at the specified index
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is invalid (below 0 or greater than the size of the managed windows list)

      • getStartingWindow

        @Nullable
W getStartingWindow()
        Finds the Window that should be displayed during the Ready phase of an application.

        The WindowManager expects a configuration flag windowManager.startingWindow to be present in order to determine which Window will be displayed during the Ready phase. If no configuration is found the WindowManager will pick the first Window found in the list of managed windows.

        The configuration flag accepts two value types:

        • a String that defines the name of the Window. You must make sure the Window has a matching name property.
        • a Number that defines the index of the Window in the list of managed windows.
        Returns:
        a Window that matches the given criteria or null if no match is found.

      • getWindows

        @Nonnull
Collection<W> getWindows()
        Returns the list of windows managed by this manager.
        Returns:
        a List of currently managed windows

      • canShutdown

        boolean canShutdown(@Nonnull
                  GriffonApplication app)
        Description copied from interface: ShutdownHandler
        Asks this handler if the application's shutdown sequence can proceed or not.

        Return false if the shutdown sequence must be aborted.

        Specified by:
        canShutdown in interface ShutdownHandler
        Parameters:
        app - the current running application
        Returns:
        true if the shutdown sequence can proceed, false otherwise
